item.title: How to Code (Part 3)
item.description: Defining Basics (Part 2) Conditionals In programming we have conditional terms to the fact that: Most/ I mean ALL of programming is conditional Every single programming language … Understanding the logic gate ideological connection behind coding Such as programming microcontrollers Arduino’s C library, Raspberry Pi’s own IDE in a custom OS etc. Thus leading to the discrete mathematical inductions of computers Understanding math behind it such as De Morgan’s law for Date-Range calculation etc.

item.title: How to Code (Part 2)
item.description: Defining Basics Since you’ve chosen a starting point, I’d state the easiest one I know myself. The main goal of the series is to guide you all the way to linked lists and OOP. My parameters are as follows Python as a compiler and source code. My own current knowledge of the language. Explaining Turing technology with a simple example. Casting So, the first thing everyone should know is that the equal sign operator is a CAST.

item.title: How to Code (Part 1)
item.description: Background To start coding, one should have ‘ikigai’ to maintain a happy relationship with your new hobby/career. Instead of finding yourself too broke to live your passion or in a scenario where you suck at something, try and focus on maintaining the good in all areas. This is ‘Ikigai’ visually: How to start ? The key to any skill if it be rugby players or mathematicians is to have a good foundational comprehension.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Hello World, I am Armand ðŸ˜Š As some of you may know, I have an obsession when it comes to PC and AI development. I am currently dedicating this blog to sharing my findings as a Junior Developer. Corporate Life To introduce myself, I work for a consultancy firm that develops software for Project Management in SAP systems for both international and national level companies. My job includes the following:
